page.title: 03RECREATION FOR 9 YEAR OLDS
page.content: RECREATION. Boys who belong to Cub Scouts wear a green sweat shirt, grey shorts, grey socks, green cap and coloured neckerchief. They pay subs, play games, and work to gain various badges which are sewn onto the shirt sleeves. Girls who belong to Brownie Guides wear a brown dress, long white socks and a brown pom pom hat. They pay subs, play games, and work to gain various badges which are sewn onto the sleeves of the dress and some onto the dress itself. Some girls go to Dancing classes where they wear lycra skirts, leotards, white or pink tights and black ballet shoes. Hair is worn up in a bun. Lessons are paid for as they are taken. Exams are taken once a year and girls are entered for festivals.
